newsitem.title: UK: Croda says Q3 trading shows pre-tax jump.
newsitem.headline: Croda says Q3 trading shows pre-tax jump.

text.p: British-based chemicals company Croda International Plc said on Monday its provisional third quarter financial data showed that, compared with a weak 1995 third quarter, pre-tax profits had risen by 35 percent and sales risen by 9.0 percent.

"This follows a 4.0 percent increase in sales in continuing businesses and a 5.0 percent increase in pre-tax profits for the first half of 1996 over those for the first half of 1995," the company added in a statement.
It said demand levels and new products gave the company optimism but sterling's strength could threaten export margins.
